messages.message: I think I have a sandbox in this condition: https://instabase.sandboxes.site/sandboxes/hongrunzhou?cw=dev
that does indeed look like the same state! I'm going to investigate some stuff with how the file service daemon is being spawned, will report back here with any findings :slightly_smiling_face:

Aha! I'm kicking myself for not seeing this before -- the sandboxes which have been working fine don't have a `~/.bash_profile` defined, meaning they fell back on the `BASH_ENV=/etc/sandbox.d/bash_env` environment variable I added to catch those contexts. Both of your hosts have `~/.bash_profile` defined, without the initialization snippet that's in `/etc/sandbox.d/bash_env`, so it was getting skipped -- adding the snippet to `~/.bash_profile`  seems to have fixed it, I'll put up a PR to do this automatically for people in a little bit!
ahhh indeed! Thanks Sean, that makes a lot of sense!
My sandbox is back running now! :thank_you:
